etymology.description: Originally a pictogram; later used as a rebus/phonetic loan for “yellow”. Shuowen (erroneous): phonetic 炗 “light” + semantic 田 “field” (top 廿 from a corrupted 口).
etymology.interpretation: Early forms likely depicted a person or a chest-worn jade ring, and the graph was later borrowed to write the color word via rebus. Later analyses that parse it as 光/田 reflect reinterpretation; the top element traces back to an earlier 口 shape.
etymology.simplification: Component simplification reduced the complex 黃 to 黄 by collapsing the top element and removing small interior strokes; this simpler form was then generalized as a component.

examples.chinese: 这件衣服是黄色的(這件衣服是黃色的)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiàn yīfu shì huángsè de.
examples.english: This piece of clothing is yellow.

examples.chinese: 秋天到了(秋天到了)，树叶变黄了(樹葉變黃了)。
examples.pinyin: Qiūtiān dàole, shùyè biàn huáng le.
examples.english: Autumn has arrived, and the leaves turn yellow.

examples.chinese: 没人投资(沒人投資)，这个项目黄了(這個項目黃了)。
examples.pinyin: Méi rén tóuzī, zhège xiàngmù huáng le.
examples.english: No one invested, so the project fell through.
